item.title: Maintain connectivity for essential services with selective network isolation
item.description: Network isolation refers to how Microsoft Defender for Endpoint restricts a compromised device’s communication within the network in order to contain threats and prevent lateral movement. But oftentimes when isolating devices, certain critical services like management tools or security solutions need to remain operational. That's why Defender for Endpoint has launched selective isolation exclusions, which allow you to exclude specific devices, processes, IP addresses, or services from unilateral network isolation actions.
